org.conqat.engine.commons.util

Class JsonUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.engine.commons.util.JsonUtils

  • public class JsonUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility code for dealing with JSON. This uses Jackson for serialization and deserialization to JSON.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JsonUtils.JsonDeserializationException
      Wrapper exception for JsonProcessingException as the other is a checked exception and we don't want to check it everywhere.
      static class  JsonUtils.JsonSerializationException
      Wrapper exception for JsonProcessingException as the other is a checked exception and we don't want to check it everywhere.

      • deserializeFromJsonWithNullCheck

        public static <T> T deserializeFromJsonWithNullCheck(java.lang.String json,
                                                     java.lang.Class<T> expectedClass)
                                              throws ConQATException
        Deserializes a JSON string. Throws an error if the resulting object is null or contains an attribute that is null.
        Throws:
        ConQATException - if the input string could not be parsed as JSON, or the class is not constructible, or the resulting object or one of its attributes would be null.

      • getWithCapitalizedOrLowercaseKey

        public static java.util.Optional<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> getWithCapitalizedOrLowercaseKey(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode jsonNode,
                                                                                                           java.lang.String key)
        Returns the json value or null for the given key, while trying 1. a lowercase version of the key (e.g. 'project'), and 2. a capitalized version of the lowercase key ('Project');

      • isValidJson

        public static boolean isValidJson(java.lang.String json)
        Returns whether a string is a valid json or not.

      • isNotSerialized

        public static boolean isNotSerialized(java.lang.reflect.Field field)
        Returns:
        whether the given field is not serialized, i.e. skipped in JSON responses to the client.
